news.title: ‘Children sometimes have nightmares about monsters. I had a real-life monster’ – woman tells of devastating abuse by ‘pillar of the community’ Pat Salmon
news.summary: A woman who was abused by a “pillar of the community” as a five-year-old child has said that while young children sometimes have nightmares about monsters, “I had a real monster”.

news.title: Sinn Féin activist held over mosque terror plot previously admitted selling cocaine
news.summary: A Sinn Féin activist who is a terror suspect in a far-right plot to attack a mosque previously admitted to selling cocaine.

news.title: Country braced for threat of ‘significant’ flooding as Status Orange alert issued for three counties
Daniel McDonnell: How Ireland ripped up the script against Portugal to earn their shot at glory
news.summary: To keep the dream alive, Ireland enjoyed an evening that challenged the boundaries of reality. Beating Portugal to give every home player – apart from Lille survivor Séamus Coleman – the best moment of their international careers is one thing.

news.title: Elf Town has had a major makeover – I took my kids along to see if the €29.95 ticket price was worth it
news.summary: There’s something unnerving about a group of small children (some your own, others unknown) getting ready to hurl fake snowballs at your head. How did I find myself in this position, you may ask?

news.title: School day’s over but a new life begins in this Skerries home
news.summary: The Old School House, Ballykea, Loughshinny, Skerries, Co Dublin

news.title: Home economics: ‘My father fell out with our sibling years ago, then reconciled, but the will was never updated – can we give the sibling some of our share?’
Modern Morals: My best friend got drunk and behaved appallingly at my mother’s funeral and I can’t get past it
‘It’s simply unacceptable’ – State admits it has no idea how many drivers are dodging paying motor tax
news.summary: The Department of Transport has admitted it does not know how many drivers are failing to pay motor tax and that it does not have a system to monitor compliance.

news.title: Prominent solicitor Anthony Joyce denies allegations of hiding funds for bankrupt clients
news.summary: A prominent lawyer accused of helping two clients to hide assets from creditors told investigators a €10,000 bank draft they gave him a month before they were declared bankrupt was to discharge legal fees and outlays due to him for representing them, a tribunal has heard.
